title: non-blocking cuda2cpu copy shouldn't require contiguity
body_html:
>>> x = torch.rand(2,3).cuda()
x.>>> x.t().cpu()
tensor([[0.6202, 0.0882],
        [0.1994, 0.1465],
        [0.5524, 0.7550]])
>>> x.t().to('cpu')
tensor([[0.6202, 0.0882],
        [0.1994, 0.1465],
        [0.5524, 0.7550]])
>>> x.t().to('cpu', non_blocking=True)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 3: Source tensor must be contiguous at /private/home/ssnl/sftp/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorCopy.cpp:141
